jam
Class Script

java.lang.Object
  jam.Script
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Observer
public final class Script
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer

Class which exposes an API for scripting offline sorting sessions. Using this class, you can write and compile a .java file which, when executed, will

  1. Launch Jam in the background.
  2. Setup offline sorting.
  3. Load an HDF file (i.e., load gates and parameters).
  4. Zero histograms (often needed after the previous step).
  5. Define the list of event files to sort.
  6. For sort routines that invoke writeEvent(), specify the event output file.
  7. (Optional) Show the Jam window to observe sort progress.
  8. Perform the sort.
  9. Save the results in an HDF file.
  10. (Optional) Add histograms in stored HDF files together.
The last step may be desirable in the case where you would like to execute portions of the sorting task on different machines at the same time, and combine their results in a "merge script".

Version:
Apr 5, 2004
Author:
Dale Visser

Constructor Detail

Script

public Script()
Creates an instance, of which the user then invokes the methods to script an offline sorting session. A non-trivial side-effect of invoking this constructor is that an instance of Jam is started up in the background.

Method Detail

defineFile

public java.io.File defineFile(java.lang.String fname)
Utility method for defining a file reference relative to the directory that java was launched from. Here's an example for Linux and MacOS X systems: If the JVM was launched from /home/user/sortscript, and this method is called with the argument "../thesisRuns/run34.evn", then a File object representing /home/user/thesisRuns/run34.evn is returned, whether or not that file really exists yet.

Parameters:
fname - relative path reference to the file of interest
Returns:
File object resolving fname against the base path given by the system property user.dir at startup

setupOffline

public void setupOffline(java.io.File classPath,
                         java.lang.String sortRoutineName,
                         java.lang.Class inStream,
                         java.lang.Class outStream)
Completes the task equivalent of specifying the settings in Jam's dialog for setting up offline sorting. That is, calling this defines the classpath to sort routines, the fully qualified name of the SortRoutine to use for sorting, and references to the EventInputStream and EventOutputStream to use.

Parameters:
classPath - the path that sort routines get loaded from
sortRoutineName - fully qualified with all package names in the standard java "dot" notation, e.g., "sort.Calorimeter" for the file sort/Calorimeter.class relative to classPath
inStream - e.g., jam.sort.stream.YaleInputStream.class
outStream - e.g., jam.sort.stream.YaleOutputStream.class
See Also:
SortRoutine, EventInputStream, EventOutputStream

addEventFile

public void addEventFile(java.io.File fileOrDir)
Add an event file to the list of event files to sort. If the file reference passed represents a directory, then all files with names ending in .evn in the directory are added to the list. Files whose names don't meet this requirement are ignored and not added to the list. This method does not recurse into the directory tree.

Parameters:
fileOrDir - .evn file or folder containing such files
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if setupOffline() hasn't been called yet

loadFileList

public void loadFileList(java.io.File list)
Reads in the given text file, interpreting each line as a filename, which gets added to the list of event files to sort. Such files are typically created using the Save List button in the Control|Sort... dialog in Jam.

Parameters:
list - text file listing event files
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if setupOffline() hasn't been called yet

setEventOutput

public void setEventOutput(java.io.File eventsOut)
Set the file to output events to when the user's sort routine invokes writeEvent()

Parameters:
eventsOut - where to write "pre-sort" events
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if setupOffline() hasn't been called yet
See Also:
SortRoutine.writeEvent(int [])

zeroHistograms

public void zeroHistograms()
Zero all histograms in memory.

beginSort

public void beginSort()
Launch the offline sort.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if setupOffline() hasn't been called yet, or if no event files have been specified

update

                   java.lang.Object param)

update in interface java.util.Observer

loadHDF

public void loadHDF(java.io.File hdf)
Load the given HDF file into memory. You must have already invoked setupSort().

Parameters:
hdf - an HDF file
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if setupOffline() hasn't been called yet

addHDF

public void addHDF(java.io.File hdf)
Add the hisgogram counts in the given HDF file, or all HDF files in the given directory, into the histograms in memory. You must have already invoked setupSort().

Parameters:
hdf - an HDF file or folder containing HDF files
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if setupOffline() hasn't been called yet

saveHDF

public void saveHDF(java.io.File hdf)
Load the given HDF file into memory.

Parameters:
hdf - an HDF file

showJam

public void showJam()
Show Jam's graphical interface. Once shown, the user may interact with Jam like normal, including interrupting the scripted process.

hideJam

public void hideJam()
Hide Jam's graphical interface.
